vulnerability_findings.name: inefficient-state-variable-increment
vulnerability_findings.message: <x> += <y> costs more gas than <x> = <x> + <y> for state variables.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_contractAddress != address(0), "An empty address cannot be quarantined");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_vaultToId[_vaultAddress] == 0, "The vault contract is already registered");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require

vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(nextDeposit < childBlockInterval, "Exceeded limit of deposits per child block interval");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-decrement-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix decrement expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix decrement expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_contractAddress != address(0), "An empty address cannot be quarantined");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.message:
BlockControllerMock.constructor.authority (local variable @ BlockControllerMock.sol#277) shadows:
	- BlockController.authority (state variable @ BlockControllerMock.sol#162)

vulnerability_findings.name: timestamp
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function isQuarantined(Data storage _self, address _contractAddress) internal view returns (bool) {

        return block.timestamp < _self.store[_contractAddress];
vulnerability_findings.message:
Quarantine.isQuarantined (BlockControllerMock.sol#36-38) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- block.timestamp < _self.store[_contractAddress] (BlockControllerMock.sol#37)

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in BlockControllerMock.sol:
	- Version used: ['0.5.11', 'ABIEncoderV2']
	- BlockControllerMock.sol#3 declares pragma solidity0.5.11
	- BlockControllerMock.sol#19 declares pragma solidity0.5.11
	- BlockControllerMock.sol#58 declares pragma solidity0.5.11
	- BlockControllerMock.sol#70 declares pragma solidity0.5.11
	- BlockControllerMock.sol#147 declares pragma solidity0.5.11
	- BlockControllerMock.sol#267 declares pragma solidity0.5.11
	- BlockControllerMock.sol#268 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function getMaintainer() public view returns (address) {

        return maintainer;
vulnerability_findings.message: BlockControllerMock.getMaintainer (BlockControllerMock.sol#294-296) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: VaultRegistry.getMaintainer (BlockControllerMock.sol#100) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: VaultRegistry.registerVault (BlockControllerMock.sol#117-128) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function vaults(uint256 _vaultId) public view returns (address) {

        return _vaults[_vaultId];
vulnerability_findings.message: VaultRegistry.vaults (BlockControllerMock.sol#133-135) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function vaultToId(address _vaultAddress) public view returns (uint256) {

        return _vaultToId[_vaultAddress];
vulnerability_findings.message: VaultRegistry.vaultToId (BlockControllerMock.sol#140-142) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: BlockController.submitDepositBlock (BlockControllerMock.sol#246-258) should be declared external
